splash.splashContent:
Welcome to the Hawaii Cesspool Prioritization Tool (HCPT). The HCPT ranks which cesspools are most likely to cause harm to people and the environment. Each colored dot on the map is a cesspool. The colored areas that match the cesspool colors are US Census Bureau tracts. All cesspools within their census tract are ranked together. The color-coded priority ranking is listed below.

Cesspool Priority Rank:
Highest contamination hazard and priority level (RED);
Medium contamination hazard and priority level (ORANGE); 
Lowest contamination hazard and priority level (YELLOW)

For more information about how we reached these results, and to read the detailed report, please visit: Wastewater Branch | Cesspool Conversion Working Group (hawaii.gov)

Email (insert address) for questions or technical assistance. 


CONDITIONS OF USE (Please Read Carefully)

EFFECTIVE DATE: 8/31/2021

The Hawaiʻi Cesspool Prioritization Tool (HCPT) was developed by the University of Hawai‘i (UH) in collaboration with the state of Hawaiʻi Department of Health Wastewater Branch (DOH), and is provided as an informational service to the public. Users are responsible for understanding the background/limitations of the tool and evaluating the appropriateness of the tool for their objectives.

Although the HCPT has been developed with the most recent and best available data, errors may be present. UH and DOH is not responsible for any resulting errors and reserves the right to update the web interface as needed pursuant to further analysis and review. No warranty, expressed or implied, is made by UH, DOH, or the State of Hawai‘i as to the functionality of the web interface and related material, nor shall the fact of release constitute any such warranty. 

Furthermore, the HCPT is released on condition that neither UH, DOH, nor State of Hawai‘i shall be held liable for any damages resulting from its authorized or unauthorized use. By using the tool you agree to the above terms and conditions. All content and results are in the public domain and may be used freely, with appropriate credit given to the authors. Suggested citation: Mezzacapo, M., Shuler, C., Renteria, A., Allen, K. Whittier, R.  2021.
